byline.contributor: Ahmad Shakib contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan.

abstract: Afghan Vice Pres Abdul Rashid Dostum, number two authority in country, was barred from entering United States on diplomatic mission in April due to accusations of war crimes; Dostum's political success, despite past as warlord, reflects compromised status of Afghan government as whole; US officials say figures like Dostum threaten country's stability as much as insurgency itself.

headline.print_headline: Vice President of Afghanistan, but Barred From U.S.
headline.main: Afghanistan’s Vice President Is Barred From Entering U.S.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Officials threatened to deny a visa to Abdul Rashid Dostum, who is accused of war crimes but is also the No. 2 official in a government whose survival depends on American troops and money.
lead_paragraph: Officials threatened to deny a visa to Abdul Rashid Dostum, who is accused of war crimes but is also the No. 2 official in a government whose survival depends on American troops and money.
